summary: A lengthy, emotionally charged email from an alleged Epstein victim to multiple recipients, primarily targeting attorneys David Boies, Brad Edwards, and Sigrid McCawley. The writer accuses them of legal malpractice, profiting from victims, deleting evidence, and obstructing justice. It demands investigations into numerous figures including Peter Mandelson, Jes Staley, and various politicians and business leaders, while referencing personal abuse, flight logs, and a coerced settlement.

persons.name: David Boies
persons.context: Primary target of accusations; accused of legal malpractice, profiting from Epstein victims, deleting evidence, and having conflicts of interest. Represented the writer and other victims.

persons.name: Brad Edwards
persons.context: Co-target of accusations with David Boies; accused of having flight logs, writing a book without victim consent, and failing to properly represent victims.

persons.name: Sigrid McCawley
persons.context: Attorney accused alongside Boies and Edwards of misconduct, providing flight logs to the writer, and participating in silencing the victim.

persons.name: Peter Mandelson
persons.context: Accused of meeting with Jeffrey Epstein and corresponding with Ghislaine Maxwell; the writer demands he be put on the stand and investigated.

persons.name: Jes Staley
persons.context: Former banker at JP Morgan and Barclays; the writer references an FCA case against him regarding his relationship with Epstein and claims he wanted her to testify.

persons.name: Jennifer Freeman
persons.context: Attorney who represented the writer; accused of preventing her from testifying in the Deutsche Bank litigation and being part of the problematic legal team.

persons.name: Adam Castellani
persons.context: Repeatedly mentioned as a perpetrator who abused the writer; his whereabouts are demanded, and photos of him are referenced.

persons.name: Kash Patel
persons.context: Addressed as a potential investigator; the writer asks him to investigate various figures, retrieve deleted evidence from her devices, and work with the FCA.

persons.name: Stan
persons.context: Mentioned as an attorney who made unwanted advances towards the writer and traveled to Israel with David Boies.

persons.name: Cyril Ramaphosa
persons.context: Accused of being involved in trafficking girls out of South Africa and protecting witnesses; the writer demands his investigation.

persons.name: Daniel Bates
persons.context: Daily Mail journalist whom the writer accuses of perverting justice and demands he share information with the FCA about Peter Mandelson.

persons.name: Rupert Murdoch
persons.context: Accused of reverting the course of justice and making backroom deals; the writer demands investigation into him and his son Lachlan.

persons.name: Alina Habba
persons.context: Attorney for Donald Trump; the writer asks where to send her devices for investigation and states Habba has been included in correspondence.

persons.name: Donald Trump
persons.context: Addressed directly multiple times; the writer asks for his help in investigating various figures and protecting her family.

persons.name: Gayle King
persons.context: Accused of having inside information on Melinda Gates and Epstein and withholding evidence; named as a witness.

persons.name: Sergey Brin
persons.context: Co-founder of Google; accused of being on Epstein's island in January 2007 with the writer and others.

persons.name: Anne Wojcicki
persons.context: CEO of 23andMe; accused of being on Epstein's island in January 2007.

persons.name: Jean Luc Brunel
persons.context: Described as the biggest distributor of Eastern European girls for sex trafficking; gave the writer a disk of evidence.

persons.name: Jamie Dimon
persons.context: CEO of JP Morgan; accused of being a 'monster', funding Epstein's trafficking, and having emails deleted.

persons.name: Prince Andrew
persons.context: Mentioned as a named defendant; the writer demands investigation into his family's involvement in perverting justice.

persons.name: Alan Dershowitz
persons.context: Named defendant; accused of providing legal services to Prince Andrew improperly and of sexual abuse allegations.

persons.name: Melissa Biden
persons.context: Referred to as the wife of David Boies's employee; shown in a photo standing next to Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Hunter Biden
persons.context: Questioned about what work he did for David Boies to earn a salary from Boies Schiller.

persons.name: Brittany
persons.context: Co-author with Brad Edwards of the book 'Relentless Pursuit', written without victim permission according to the writer.

persons.name: Paul Cassell
persons.context: Named as one of the attorneys involved in the litigation whom the writer addresses.

persons.name: James Marsh
persons.context: Named as one of the attorneys involved in the litigation whom the writer addresses.

persons.name: Gloria Allred
persons.context: Named as someone who should be investigated by Kash Patel.

persons.name: Lisa Bloom
persons.context: Daughter of Gloria Allred; named as someone who should be investigated by Kash Patel.

persons.name: Erin O'Loughlin
persons.context: From the ACFCS; described as a friend who witnessed the writer's struggles with attorneys and JP Morgan.

persons.name: Brian Kindle
persons.context: From the ACFCS; his contact details are provided to the FCA.

persons.name: Miles Alexander
persons.context: Named as a witness and estate manager of Epstein Island; the writer demands his testimony.

persons.name: Cathy Alexander
persons.context: Named as a witness and estate manager of Epstein Island; the writer demands her testimony.

persons.name: Keir Starmer
persons.context: British Labour leader; accused of profiting from trafficking and obstructing justice; the writer taunts him.

persons.name: Rishi Sunak
persons.context: Former British Prime Minister; added to the witness list as the writer tried to contact him when he was her local MP.

persons.name: Vladimir Putin
persons.context: Addressed directly; the writer asks him and Trump to protect her family and investigate trafficking.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Central figure in the case; referenced throughout as the trafficker and abuser. The writer mentions he called her 'trouble'.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Epstein's associate; mentioned as being on the island and corresponding with Peter Mandelson.

connections.description: Attorneys accused of jointly representing Epstein victims, profiting from settlements, and engaging in legal malpractice together.
Colleagues at the same law firm accused of collaborating to silence the victim, delete evidence, and mishandle her case.
Co-authors of the book 'Relentless Pursuit', which the writer claims was written without the permission of the victims they represented.
Described as colleagues at JP Morgan at the same time; their association is central to the writer's accusations.
The writer questions what work Hunter Biden did for David Boies's firm to earn a 'handsome salary'.
The writer claims email correspondence existed between Mandelson and Maxwell, which should be used as evidence.
Colleagues who traveled to Israel together regularly while representing the writer and Ghislaine Maxwell.
Staley's attorneys contacted Jennifer Freeman to have the writer testify in the Deutsche Bank litigation.
Brunel gave a disk of evidence to Sergey Brin, according to the writer's claims.
Accused of doing backroom deals together to profit from Epstein victims and keep names out of the media.

events.title: Epstein Island Gathering
events.description: The writer claims to have been on Epstein's island in January 2007 with Sergey Brin, Anne Wojcicki, Ghislaine Maxwell, and others.

events.title: Photo with Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: Reference to a photo from 2016 showing Ghislaine Maxwell standing next to Melissa Biden, the wife of David Boies's employee.

events.title: Email Accusations Sent
events.description: The date the primary email was sent, containing a wide range of accusations against attorneys, politicians, and business figures.

events.title: Christmas at Epstein's Apartment
events.description: The writer claims she cooked roast chicken for a friend (referenced as a redacted name) and an Eastern European friend in Jeffrey Epstein's apartment on Christmas Day 2006.

events.title: Voice Message to FCA
events.description: The writer left a voice message with the UK Financial Conduct Authority (FCA) regarding Jes Staley, as referenced in an FCA response email included in the thread.

keyFacts: The writer, an alleged Epstein victim, accuses her former attorneys (David Boies, Brad Edwards, Sigrid McCawley) of legal malpractice, profiting from victims, deleting evidence from her devices, and coercing her into a settlement while she was not medically fit.
The writer claims that the attorneys have had the flight logs for everyone who traveled on Epstein's plane since day one but have not released them.
The writer demands investigations into British politician Peter Mandelson for his alleged meetings and correspondence with Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell.
The writer references a class action lawsuit that was dismissed and claims victims were coerced into signing contracts constructed by David Boies and Brad Edwards.
The writer states that evidence, including photos and emails, has been repeatedly deleted from her Apple devices, which she attributes to the attorneys or other involved parties.
